well most mages take the arcane blade mastery and gw is applied on magic damage, not spell damage. and honestly adding grievous wounds is a better thing for the game. it takes away the case of ad champions being so far ahead that you cant even 1v5 them because you are to far behind to burst them, and they will just lifesteal up all the damage you dealt, becuase now, when they are that far ahead, you can have someone build EC and the damage you deal to them sticks. the only problem with EC is the balancing around champions like {{champion:9}}, {{champion:36}}, {{champion:266}}, etc. where some of their power budget is spent on that sustain, and when they have GW on them, they are strictly worse than other champions that have similar roles. but once you re-tune these champions for the easy access to GW, there really isnt a problem, and it is going to lead to a better game

By retune, I assume you mean rework. Only possible way to retune them back into relevancy is to make their sustain ignore GW. Doesnt matter how they adjust the numbers on the sustain, it will always be crippled by GW.

Honestly, Riot is next level retarded in the way they implemented this. The application of GW should have been an active effect that lasts for a short window of time with a cooldown. This way, smart players who deserve to win can use it to skillfully shutdown problematic sustain, while other skillful players can take advantage of the actives downtime and utilize the strength of their sustain. Instead its an 800g purchase-and-forget item for brainless sheep. That seems to be who riot caters to these days.

I know this is a circle jerk thread but my guess is this:
Theres two things that Greivous wounds affect; Tanks and ADCs.
ADCs are easily blown up from near full health (by most mages), and Tanks aren't supposed to be blown up by mages from full health(again, generally). But if they're already below 40%, then it'd be lame to let Mundo with Spirit Visage heal up to 100 WHILE you're casting at him.

ADC's are pretty much the designated tank and tower killer, so them having access to greivous wounds makes sense. And even with the item, I doubt teams are gonna be telling Caitlyn to focus down Shen.

Lastly, mages are so completely different from each other, it's super difficult to make items that are balanced for all of them (Spellvamp for instance; a stat that when tweaked wrong doesn't affect Diana much but makes Vladimir insane). If morellos worked on spell casts against targets at any health percentage, some mages would be_ constantly applying it to your entire team_ which would be wrong.

GW hurts Fighters more than any other class. Champs like Darius Nasus Trundle aren't inherently tanky and rely on replenishing HP during a fight if they want to be useful, and in ADC metas they are already bad to begin with because they get kited, can't initiate or peel for their ADC the way a tank can, and can't get rid of the opposing ADC the way an assassin can, there becomes no reason to pick them. Adding full time GW in an upcoming ADC meta is just going to put fighters back into the trash bin.

Okay, well my point still stands, who's supposed to kill Darius, Trundle and Nasus?
Mages have cooldowns on their damage, and a large part of their killing potential usually relies on their ultimates.
AD Carries kill with auto attacks, and will burn down these juggernauts with consistent damage.


For all intents and purposes Darius Trundle and Nasus are tanks that trade CC for incredible damage. These are far more problematic than standard tanks because unlike Shen you can't ignore them in a fight once they blow their CC. Currently, Darius is considered OP, and Nasus singlehandedly ends games (at a certain point).

Being kited is supposed to be a weakness ( a weakness they can eventually work around with Items), and theres always going to be a reason to pick these champs (To lane bully, counter other melee carries, and farm stacks until you can one shot towers, respectively).
